document.heading: Policemen and Firemen’s Retirement Relief Board Amendment Act of 1994

history.narrative: Law 10-174, the “Policemen and Firemen’s Retirement Relief Board Amendment Act of 1994,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 10-578, which was referred to the Committee on Government Operations. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 21, 1994, and July 5, 1994, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on July 25, 1994, it was assigned Act No. 10-294 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 10-174 became effective on September 22, 1994.

Attached to this bill, for your information, is the report of the Council’s standing committee with jurisdiction over this matter. Si nce~e/lY I)avid g. BE IT ENACTED BY TIIE COUNCIl, OF TtIE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be eiled as the "Policemen and Firemen’s Retirement Relief Board Amendment Act of 1994 See. 2. Section 122(a) of An Act To increase compensation for District of Columbia policemen, firemen, and teachers; to increase annuities payable to retired teachers in the District of Columbia; to establish an equitable tax on real property in the District of Columbia; to provide for additional revenue for the District of Columbia; and for other purposes, approved September 3, 1974 (88 Star. 1041; D.C. Code § 4-628(a is amended as follows a) Paragraph (1) is amended to read as follows 1) Members and alternatives appointed from among persons who are employees of the District of Columbia, 1 member and 1 or more alternates from each of the following: the District of Columbia Office of Personnel, Corporation Counsel, Department of IIuman Services, the Metropolitan Police Force, and the Fire and Emergency Medical Services Department; and b) The undesignated sentence following paragraph (2) is amended as follows 1) By striking the word "alternate" and inserting the phrase "1 or more alternates" in its place; and (2) By striking the word "both Sec. 3. This act shall take effect after a 30-day period of Congressional review following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council of the District of Columbia to override the veto) as provided in section 602(c)(1) of the District of Columbia Self-Government and Governmental Reorganization Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Star. 813; D.C. V l=resem, nol volm~l CERTIFICATION I=IECOFIO RAY SM~ TH’ THOMAS, COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA NOTICE D.C, LAW 10-174 "Policemen and Firemen’s Retirement Relief Board Amendment Act of 1994 Pursuant to Section 412 of the District of Columbia Self-Government and Governmental Reorganization Act, P. L. 93-198 "the Act the Council of the District of Columbia adopted Bill No. I0-578 on first and second readings, June 21, 1994 and July 5, 1994, respectively. Following the signature of the Mayor on July 25, 1994, this legislation was assigned Act No. I0-294, and published in the August 5, 1994, edition of the D.C. Register (Vol.41 page 5171) and transmitted to Congress on July 28, 1994 for a 30-day review, in accordance with Section 602(c)(I) of the Act. The Council of the District of Columbia hereby gives notice that the 30-day Congressional Review Period has expired, and therefore, cites this enactment as D.C~ Law I0-174 effective September 22, 1994 DAVID A. CLARKE Chairman of the Council Dates Counted During the 30-day Congressional Review Period: July August September 28,29 1,2,3,4,5,8,9,10,II,12,15,16,17,18,19,22,23,24,25,26 12,13,14,15,16,19,20,21 AN ACT D, C CI_I 0-294 Enrolled Original Codification District of CohJmbia Cede 1995 Supplement) IN TIlE COUNCIL OF TItE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA JULY 25, 1994 To amend An Act To increase compensation for District of Columbia policemen, firemen and teachers; to increase annuities payable to retired teachers in the District of Columbia; to establish an equitable tax on real property in the District of Columbia; to provide for additional revenue for the District of Columbia; and for other purposes to add additional alternate member to the Police and Firemen’s Retirement Relief Board. BE IT ENACTED BY TIIE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "Policemen and Firemen’s Retirement Relief Board Amendment Act of 1994 Sec. 2. Section 122(a) of An Act To increase compensation for District of Columbia policemen, firemen, and teachers; to increase annuities payable to retired teachers in the District of Columbia; to establish an equitable tax on real property in the District of Columbia; to provide for additional revenue for the District of Columbia; and for other purposes, approved September 3, 1974 (88 Star. 1041; D.C. Code § 4-628(a is amended as follows a) Paragraph (1) is amended to read as follows 1) Members and alternatives appointed from among persons who are employees of the District of Columbia, 1 member and 1 or more alternates from each of the following: the District of Columbia Office of Personnel, Corporation Counsel, Department of Human Services, the Metropolitan Police Force, and the Fire and E~nergency Medical Services Department; and b) The undesignated sentence following paragraph (2) is amended as follows 1) By striking the word "alternate" and inserting the phrase "1 or more alternates" in its place; and (2) By striking the word "both Sec. 3. This act shall take effect after a 30-day period of Congressional review following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council of the District of Columbia to override the veto) as provided in section 602(c)(1) of the District of Columbia Self-Government and Governmental Reorganization Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Star. 813; D.C.
